Browse the source code of netbsd/external/lgpl3/mpfr/dist/src/rem1.c

1/* mpfr_rem1 -- internal function
2 mpfr_fmod -- compute the floating-point remainder of x/y
3 mpfr_remquo and mpfr_remainder -- argument reduction functions
4
5Copyright 2007-2018 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
6Contributed by the AriC and Caramba projects, INRIA.
7
8This file is part of the GNU MPFR Library.
9
10The GNU MPFR Library is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify
11it under the terms of the GNU Lesser General Public License as published by
12the Free Software Foundation; either version 3 of the License, or (at your
13option) any later version.
14
15The GNU MPFR Library is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but
16WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY
17or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU Lesser General Public
18License for more details.
19
20You should have received a copy of the GNU Lesser General Public License
21along with the GNU MPFR Library; see the file COPYING.LESSER. If not, see
22http://www.gnu.org/licenses/ or write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
2351 Franklin St, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA 02110-1301, USA. */
24
25# include "mpfr-impl.h"
26
27/* we return as many bits as we can, keeping just one bit for the sign */
28# define WANTED_BITS (sizeof(long) * CHAR_BIT - 1)
29
30/*
31 rem1 works as follows:
32 The first rounding mode rnd_q indicate if we are actually computing
33 a fmod (MPFR_RNDZ) or a remainder/remquo (MPFR_RNDN).
34
35 Let q = x/y rounded to an integer in the direction rnd_q.
36 Put x - q*y in rem, rounded according to rnd.
37 If quo is not null, the value stored in *quo has the sign of q,
38 and agrees with q with the 2^n low order bits.
39 In other words, *quo = q (mod 2^n) and *quo q >= 0.
40 If rem is zero, then it has the sign of x.
41 The returned 'int' is the inexact flag giving the place of rem wrt x - q*y.
42
43 If x or y is NaN: *quo is undefined, rem is NaN.
44 If x is Inf, whatever y: *quo is undefined, rem is NaN.
45 If y is Inf, x not NaN nor Inf: *quo is 0, rem is x.
46 If y is 0, whatever x: *quo is undefined, rem is NaN.
47 If x is 0, whatever y (not NaN nor 0): *quo is 0, rem is x.
48
49 Otherwise if x and y are neither NaN, Inf nor 0, q is always defined,
50 thus *quo is.
51 Since |x - q*y| <= y/2, no overflow is possible.
52 Only an underflow is possible when y is very small.
53 */
54
55static int
56mpfr_rem1 (mpfr_ptr rem, long *quo, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_q,
57 mpfr_srcptr x, mpfr_srcptr y, mpfr_rnd_t rnd)
58{
59 mpfr_exp_t ex, ey;
60 int compare, inex, q_is_odd, sign, signx = MPFR_SIGN (x);
61 mpz_t mx, my, r;
62 int tiny = 0;
63
64 MPFR_ASSERTD (rnd_q == MPFR_RNDN || rnd_q == MPFR_RNDZ);
65
66 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (MPFR_IS_SINGULAR (x) || MPFR_IS_SINGULAR (y)))
67 {
68 if (MPFR_IS_NAN (x) || MPFR_IS_NAN (y) || MPFR_IS_INF (x)
69 || MPFR_IS_ZERO (y))
70 {
71 /* for remquo, quo is undefined */
72 MPFR_SET_NAN (rem);
73 MPFR_RET_NAN;
74 }
75 else /* either y is Inf and x is 0 or non-special,
76 or x is 0 and y is non-special,
77 in both cases the quotient is zero. */
78 {
79 if (quo)
80 *quo = 0;
81 return mpfr_set (rem, x, rnd);
82 }
83 }
84
85 /* now neither x nor y is NaN, Inf or zero */
86
87 mpz_init (mx);
88 mpz_init (my);
89 mpz_init (r);
90
91 ex = mpfr_get_z_2exp (mx, x); /* x = mx*2^ex */
92 ey = mpfr_get_z_2exp (my, y); /* y = my*2^ey */
93
94 /* to get rid of sign problems, we compute it separately:
95 quo(-x,-y) = quo(x,y), rem(-x,-y) = -rem(x,y)
96 quo(-x,y) = -quo(x,y), rem(-x,y) = -rem(x,y)
97 thus quo = sign(x/y)*quo(|x|,|y|), rem = sign(x)*rem(|x|,|y|) */
98 sign = (signx == MPFR_SIGN (y)) ? 1 : -1;
99 mpz_abs (mx, mx);
100 mpz_abs (my, my);
101 q_is_odd = 0;
102
103 /* divide my by 2^k if possible to make operations mod my easier */
104 {
105 unsigned long k = mpz_scan1 (my, 0);
106 ey += k;
107 mpz_fdiv_q_2exp (my, my, k);
108 }
109
110 if (ex <= ey)
111 {
112 /* q = x/y = mx/(my*2^(ey-ex)) */
113
114 /* First detect cases where q=0, to avoid creating a huge number
115 my*2^(ey-ex): if sx = mpz_sizeinbase (mx, 2) and sy =
116 mpz_sizeinbase (my, 2), we have x < 2^(ex + sx) and
117 y >= 2^(ey + sy - 1), thus if ex + sx <= ey + sy - 1
118 the quotient is 0 */
119 if (ex + (mpfr_exp_t) mpz_sizeinbase (mx, 2) <
120 ey + (mpfr_exp_t) mpz_sizeinbase (my, 2))
121 {
122 tiny = 1;
123 mpz_set (r, mx);
124 mpz_set_ui (mx, 0);
125 }
126 else
127 {
128 mpz_mul_2exp (my, my, ey - ex); /* divide mx by my*2^(ey-ex) */
129
130 /* since mx > 0 and my > 0, we can use mpz_tdiv_qr in all cases */
131 mpz_tdiv_qr (mx, r, mx, my);
132 /* 0 <= |r| <= |my|, r has the same sign as mx */
133 }
134
135 if (rnd_q == MPFR_RNDN)
136 q_is_odd = mpz_tstbit (mx, 0);
137 if (quo) /* mx is the quotient */
138 {
139 mpz_tdiv_r_2exp (mx, mx, WANTED_BITS);
140 *quo = mpz_get_si (mx);
141 }
142 }
143 else /* ex > ey */
144 {
145 if (quo) /* remquo case */
146 /* for remquo, to get the low WANTED_BITS more bits of the quotient,
147 we first compute R = X mod Y*2^WANTED_BITS, where X and Y are
148 defined below. Then the low WANTED_BITS of the quotient are
149 floor(R/Y). */
150 mpz_mul_2exp (my, my, WANTED_BITS); /* 2^WANTED_BITS*Y */
151
152 else if (rnd_q == MPFR_RNDN) /* remainder case */
153 /* Let X = mx*2^(ex-ey) and Y = my. Then both X and Y are integers.
154 Assume X = R mod Y, then x = X*2^ey = R*2^ey mod (Y*2^ey=y).
155 To be able to perform the rounding, we need the least significant
156 bit of the quotient, i.e., one more bit in the remainder,
157 which is obtained by dividing by 2Y. */
158 mpz_mul_2exp (my, my, 1); /* 2Y */
159
160 mpz_set_ui (r, 2);
161 mpz_powm_ui (r, r, ex - ey, my); /* 2^(ex-ey) mod my */
162 mpz_mul (r, r, mx);
163 mpz_mod (r, r, my);
164
165 if (quo) /* now 0 <= r < 2^WANTED_BITS*Y */
166 {
167 mpz_fdiv_q_2exp (my, my, WANTED_BITS); /* back to Y */
168 mpz_tdiv_qr (mx, r, r, my);
169 /* oldr = mx*my + newr */
170 *quo = mpz_get_si (mx);
171 q_is_odd = *quo & 1;
172 }
173 else if (rnd_q == MPFR_RNDN) /* now 0 <= r < 2Y in the remainder case */
174 {
175 mpz_fdiv_q_2exp (my, my, 1); /* back to Y */
176 /* least significant bit of q */
177 q_is_odd = mpz_cmpabs (r, my) >= 0;
178 if (q_is_odd)
179 mpz_sub (r, r, my);
180 }
181 /* now 0 <= |r| < |my|, and if needed,
182 q_is_odd is the least significant bit of q */
183 }
184
185 if (mpz_cmp_ui (r, 0) == 0)
186 {
187 inex = mpfr_set_ui (rem, 0, MPFR_RNDN);
188 /* take into account sign of x */
189 if (signx < 0)
190 mpfr_neg (rem, rem, MPFR_RNDN);
191 }
192 else
193 {
194 if (rnd_q == MPFR_RNDN)
195 {
196 /* FIXME: the comparison 2*r < my could be done more efficiently
197 at the mpn level */
198 mpz_mul_2exp (r, r, 1);
199 /* if tiny=1, we should compare r with my*2^(ey-ex) */
200 if (tiny)
201 {
202 if (ex + (mpfr_exp_t) mpz_sizeinbase (r, 2) <
203 ey + (mpfr_exp_t) mpz_sizeinbase (my, 2))
204 compare = 0; /* r*2^ex < my*2^ey */
205 else
206 {
207 mpz_mul_2exp (my, my, ey - ex);
208 compare = mpz_cmpabs (r, my);
209 }
210 }
211 else
212 compare = mpz_cmpabs (r, my);
213 mpz_fdiv_q_2exp (r, r, 1);
214 compare = ((compare > 0) ||
215 ((rnd_q == MPFR_RNDN) && (compare == 0) && q_is_odd));
216 /* if compare != 0, we need to subtract my to r, and add 1 to quo */
217 if (compare)
218 {
219 mpz_sub (r, r, my);
220 if (quo && (rnd_q == MPFR_RNDN))
221 *quo += 1;
222 }
223 }
224 /* take into account sign of x */
225 if (signx < 0)
226 mpz_neg (r, r);
227 inex = mpfr_set_z_2exp (rem, r, ex > ey ? ey : ex, rnd);
228 }
229
230 if (quo)
231 *quo *= sign;
232
233 mpz_clear (mx);
234 mpz_clear (my);
235 mpz_clear (r);
236
237 return inex;
238}
239
240int
241mpfr_remainder (mpfr_ptr rem, mpfr_srcptr x, mpfr_srcptr y, mpfr_rnd_t rnd)
242{
243 return mpfr_rem1 (rem, (long *) 0, MPFR_RNDN, x, y, rnd);
244}
245
246int
247mpfr_remquo (mpfr_ptr rem, long *quo,
248 mpfr_srcptr x, mpfr_srcptr y, mpfr_rnd_t rnd)
249{
250 return mpfr_rem1 (rem, quo, MPFR_RNDN, x, y, rnd);
251}
252
253int
254mpfr_fmod (mpfr_ptr rem, mpfr_srcptr x, mpfr_srcptr y, mpfr_rnd_t rnd)
255{
256 return mpfr_rem1 (rem, (long *) 0, MPFR_RNDZ, x, y, rnd);
257}
258
259int
260mpfr_fmodquo (mpfr_ptr rem, long *quo, mpfr_srcptr x, mpfr_srcptr y,
261 mpfr_rnd_t rnd)
262{
263 return mpfr_rem1 (rem, quo, MPFR_RNDZ, x, y, rnd);
264}
